meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or characteristic of a parasite.
meanings.sent1: The plant showed parasitical behavior by leeching nutrients from its neighboring plants.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the parasitical nature of the tiny organism.
meanings.sent3: The parasitical vine seemed to be enjoying a free buffet at the expense of the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her parasitical tendencies in relationships drained the happiness out of those around her.
meanings.sent5: The parasitical relationship between the two countries was evident in their unequal trade agreements.

meanings.definition: Obtaining nourishment at the expense of a host.
meanings.sent1: The parasitical in the forest relied on other animals for their survival.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained how the parasitical feeds off its host to grow.
meanings.sent3: The parasitical at the party was constantly eating without contributing anything.
meanings.sent4: The company was like a parasitical, thriving only by exploiting its employees.
meanings.sent5: The parasitical in the ecosystem disrupted the balance by overfeeding on its host species.
